website_summaries.verdict: Budget-friendly option with a handy steam option and dual voltage for overseas travel.
pros: Great performance, even on heavyweight fabric
Heats up quickly and is easy to use
Easily adjust temp according to type of fabric being ironed
cons: No auto shut-off feature, and some users find the small size difficult to handle

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I only used this iron once before it ruined my clothes and carpet. When I first got it, it leaked. But I didn't think much of it. It worked alright and got the job done, you just had to be careful. The 2nd time I used though, rust colored water started falling out of the steam holes and stained the shirt I was going to iron and also my carpet. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this. It will ruin your clothes.
customer_reviews.text: It' s adequate at first. It may be good for travel, but it's too small to work well. It leaks. About half the water you put in is effectively converted to steam. After about 11 months of minimal usage, it began to rust/corrode internally. In the first minute of operation, it sputters and spits a mixture of brownish liquid and white sand-like particles. This terrible secretion stains clothes. I should mention that I've only filled it with filtered water.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting! Used Iron Shipped
customer_reviews.text: Gross!!!! This iron came to me today used and rusted. There’s still water left over from whoever returned it!!!! Now I have to waste my time and ship this back!
customer_reviews.author: nansee_ann

customer_reviews.title: Practical item for a practical price
customer_reviews.text: Powerful little iron. I use it with a tiny board for seams while sewing. I keep it next to my sewing machine.
customer_reviews.author: cathyfrommaine

customer_reviews.title: Spewing brown liquid
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mini iron for my mini nyc apt and after 7 months of minimal/moderate use, it's spewing out brown liquid.. on my brand new white jumpsuit... Tried cleaning it using he instructions in the box and it's still happening.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Nystrom

customer_reviews.title: I am satisfied. I have not tried this on clothing so ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to wax a snowboard. For the price and ease of use, I am satisfied. I have not tried this on clothing so I can not say anything about the value for that application. Use a little trial and error for the best temperature setting with whatever wax you are using. The temp settings are easy to adjust. The pointed corners are good for dripping wax across the board. the small shape of the iron fits comfortably in the palm of my hand and spreads the wax well.
customer_reviews.author: SMD

customer_reviews.title: Bit finicky but works.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you follow the instructions. The brown liquid that people show is old leftover liquid from factory quality assurance testing. Just fill it to the line, and puff out until there is no more brown liquid. Also, don't puff too many times in a row. Give it a few seconds in between. Or else you'll get too much.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed AlHussainan

customer_reviews.title: Came cracked
customer_reviews.text: My iron came cracked and scratched all over it like its been used. Extremely unhappy and expected better from Sunbeam.
customer_reviews.author: SMielke

customer_reviews.title: Beware you might get a used one the iron didn’t even work
customer_reviews.text: Product was used previously before.I ended up receiving a rusted used iron with leftover water inside from previous owner, when I purchased a “new” one.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: It leaks rusty water over your clothes!!!
customer_reviews.text: May be used as an standard iron and then, ok, it works fine. But NEVER as a STEAMER!!! When ours arrived, on the "première" it spilled rust drops on my boyfriend's shirt anf we had NEVER put water on it! It came WET as if it was USED. And even now, we cannot use it as a steamer because rusty water drops drip from it with the steam. I have regretted not to have bought the Gideon Steamed which was my first choice. Still not know why I've changed my mind and bought this one. :/
customer_reviews.author: Paula Berlowitz

customer_reviews.title: The first time I used the iron, I plugged ...
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used the iron, I plugged it in, the light came on, but the iron never heated even after being plugged in for 10 minutes. The plate was still cold. Unfortunately, this was after Amazon's return policy had expired. I tried contacting Sunbeam directly, no response.
customer_reviews.author: dance.tx

customer_reviews.title: Died After Two Months! No Protection From Heat On Handhold - Don't Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I gave an overall 1 star because I bought it on May 8, 2020 and it was dead on July 13, 2020. Additionally, the steam function caused hot water to spit out when I put the iron down and the hand hold would get hot so that I would use several pieces of fabric to protect my hand. I chose to keep it on no steam and the fabric to protect my hand because of the convenience of having a small and light weight iron to use for making masks. But the iron dying after two months was the last straw.
customer_reviews.author: S J Stevens

customer_reviews.title: I adore this tiny iron! GREAT for sewing, pressing seams
customer_reviews.text: The miniature irons for pressing seams are priced way too high- & I really didn't want two separate irons in the house (one for seams, one for pressing garments) so I thought why not try this tiny iron? This thing is AWESOME! I threw my old clunky iron in the garbage, now just use this one for both sewing AND pressing clothes (who irons today? I do- but I like linen clothes) it's small enough to be cute for pressing seams open, yet large enough to use for clothes too. It's just fantastic, I love it in every way. You won't be disappointed you bought it, I wasn't.
customer_reviews.author: Analog

customer_reviews.title: Great travel iron
customer_reviews.text: This iron is just as effective and powerful as a full-sized one. I bought it for travel and can't wait to use it - it's nice and small and doesn't weigh too much. I did notice some leaking like others mentioned, but not enough to deter me from using it. And it also has a switch at the bottom to change voltage!! This will definitely be super convenient when traveling abroad.
customer_reviews.author: Raz684

customer_reviews.title: leaked all over
customer_reviews.text: i did buy the open box version.... but it looked like even if it was brand new the design was such that it would have leaked pretty quick anyway. also the butt of the cord where it attaches to the base is VERY stiff and causes the whole unit to sit on a tilt that is not safe. IMHO i ADORE my big honkin' sunbeam iron and was looking for a smaller version to use while making masks for our community, as i have many many little pieces to iron. i will stick with the monster that i love.
customer_reviews.author: ampm247

customer_reviews.title: Love this for sewing
customer_reviews.text: I’m in the middle of sewing masks & bought the iron due to space. I absolutely love it. It gets very hot perfect for pressing seems. Size is perfect. Wish it had a on/off switch but for the price it’s fine,
customer_reviews.author: J.Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Sunbeam Hot 2 Trot  travel iron: Tiny, hot and steamy iron
customer_reviews.text: I love this iron. If I could rate it 10, I would. It fits in all the tiny crevices and is so light weight, even my arthritic, carpal tunneled wrists can easily lift and maneuver it. It only has steam holes in the tip, but it steams as if it is riddled with holes. It holds much more water than irons twice its size and will get very hot. What else can I say...I want to buy 3 more, just to have because they are so little and cute and work so good.
customer_reviews.author: dolly pardons

customer_reviews.title: What Steam?
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this iron no stars I would. Used it one time, emptied out the reservoir per the instructions and put the iron away. The next time I went to use it, orange colored water (most likely rust) dripped out of it. Luckily, I was not using it on anything expensive or that couldn't be washed. Steam? Forget that. Not a hint of steam not even when you push the "shot of steam" button. Do yourself a favor and do not buy this product.You will be as sorry as I am.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Zee

customer_reviews.title: It only worked for 2 weeks!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Any other iron that I've ever used worked for at least 10 years or until I decided to get a newer one. This thing couldn't even get me through a full payperiod at work. It just stopped getting a power out of nowhere. Had to go to work with wrenkled cloths. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Djmeechymeech

customer_reviews.title: Putting up with it but WOULD NOT buy again
customer_reviews.text: Has spit when using steam from day one. I've switched to dry pressing most of the time so that's tolerable. Heats VERY hot on top setting. Actually created a brown burnt spot on my pressing board. Can live with that by using a lower setting. As others have said the shot of seam is difficult to use. Apparently I cannot return this item. I intend replace it. But I won't buy this again. Overall I'm disappointed. This little iron has the potential of being a great product if only production were subject to better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Dream Sewer

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous Steam Quirk
customer_reviews.text: Compact and lightweight. But the steam feature is whacked. Instead of steaming on the fabric, it sputters and spits steam out after it's set upright. Very dangerous. I emailed Sunbeam and they sent a replacement that does exactly the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: jedi-gramma

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: After 20 minutes of ironing with this thing, and using the whole water tank's worth of steam, there is no noticable difference in the number of wrinkles from when I started. Complete waste of time an effort. Additionaly, the size of the iron is not very good for gripping. It fealt like I had to stretch my fingers out to get the grip as it was too wide. And every time you push the steam button the button make a small squeaking sound that sounds like you just stepped on a puppy's tail and made them whine. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Odum

customer_reviews.title: Received used iron
customer_reviews.text: This is about how item arrived. As soon as I saw the box, I knew this was a used item. It was packed in the box nicely. It had been used - there is visible condensation. Disappointed. Sending back- paying full price I expect a new item.
customer_reviews.author: E.M.

customer_reviews.title: Would have loved to keep it
customer_reviews.text: I would have loved to keep this iron. It's small and light weight. But it leaks! It leaks when I tried to use the steam function. First time I pressed the steam button nothing happened. Second time i press the steam button a minuscule amount of steam came out and then a little stream of water followed. Thankfully I was testing the iron on a dish towel. Enough water came out of the iron to leave a sizable wet spot. I suppose if you have no intention of using the steam function then sure, buy this product. If you have projects that will need a steam, don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Noob123

customer_reviews.title: Arrived used and damaged
customer_reviews.text: The iron I received was used and damaged. The water chamber still had water in it and the button on the underside was completely missing, there was only a hole where it was supposed to be. The metal was scuffed and damaged from extensive use. If this product had been brand new, it probably would have been good quality
customer_reviews.author: Kcup

customer_reviews.title: Not for steaming things
customer_reviews.text: Read reviews, but tried anyway. Spit the entire time, fortunately, new, so water wasn’t damaging to project, but, gave up on it working through the spitting and emptied it out. Not a big thing for me, I have a spray that I use when sewing to help stabilize the fabric. The iron Itself is a great little Iron! Heats rapidly, easy to hold & turn off and on. One reviewer said theirs didn’t ever go totally off, mine seems to, base is cool/cold to touch within a short while. (Although, I never leave irons plugged in when I’m not in there using them!)
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love this so much i'm ironing everything!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use for some art projects but am so impressed with it, I don't want to get it dirty now. I haven't ironed in YEARS! No ironing board and a relic of an iron that I hate. But this little gem is easy to use with an ironing pad anywhere. With Covid keeping me at home more than usual, I iron my little masks, my pillowcases and dinner napkins. Makes being at home just a little bit nicer and I can't believe I am writing this, but it's so satisfying to witness those wrinkles disappear!
customer_reviews.author: artsiecook

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little iron
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little iron to repair my duvet that had two small tears in it from my cat jumping on the bed. I’ve had it for about week and decided to repair my duvet before it got worse. I noticed the iron had water droplets inside the reservoir....maybe it was used before? I don’t know...but I was able to repair my duvet with no problem! Worked perfectly, was ready and extremely hot in seconds! Cute little iron for the small job I had in mind! Would recommend this little iron for quick jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Jadine

customer_reviews.title: Worked twice.
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased product after reading the positive reviews about it being a convenient on-the-go iron for small tasks such as pressing seams. Used this the first time to press seams, and it was fine despite smelling odd (as expected with new products). Used this the second time to iron on a patch- but no matter how much I tried it wouldn't stick and the iron didn't get hot enough. Fast forward to present day, trying to use the iron to attach some interfacing. Plugged it into all of the outlets in the house and it won't heat up at all. Rated for a product that got two mediocre uses out of it, max. It's dead, Jim.
customer_reviews.author: Soshi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little iron
customer_reviews.text: Needed to iron a patch on a pair of jeans, this little iron worked perfectly for the job. Small footprint, big impact! I will be moving to studio apartment next year, so searched for a small iron. Found three here on Amazon and narrowed my choice to this one and i'm not disappointed. Small enough for my hands and big enough to get the job done. I don't use the steam feature so I cannot comment on it. The cord is long enough to maneuver around whatever you wish to iron. Even small enough to take on vacation or a business trip! Very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Brick ONeil

customer_reviews.title: Great little iron that leaks
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little iron. I needed a lightweight one with a more ergonomic handle and this for the bill. It's puts out a lot of steam and gets very hot. The only issue is that the water reservoir leaks. It's a design flaw because the cover opens toward the standup end. It leaks three second it's placed in a standing or upright position. They should have had the cover open towards the front of the iron.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Linden

customer_reviews.title: Hot to Trot Indeed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for table=side tiny projects, not so much for travel. My full-sized iron must have known because it died the day after delivery. In the middle of a major quilting project, this tiny iron stepped up to the job until I could get a replacement for my full-sized iron. I didn't even notice the tag line until after I was already hooked. Light weight, heats fast, AND a great name. I'm a fan!
customer_reviews.author: Aunt Tee

customer_reviews.title: Sunbeam Hot-2-Trot 800 Watt Compact Non-Stick Soleplate Travel Iron, GCSBTR-100-000
customer_reviews.text: This iron leaks so you can't use it to steam iron anything. I put water in the reservoir according to instructions (way under the fill line) while the iron was set to no steam and the dial set to off. Plugged the iron in and selected the temperature, set the iron on the heel rest to let the iron heat for 2 minutes. When I picked the iron up it was pouring water out of reservoir all over the ironing board. Even though the iron cost less than $13 it's not worth your time and money. You will be better off spending a little more to get a travel steam iron that works.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Simbeck

customer_reviews.title: Nice but too small like a toy.
customer_reviews.text: It is light weight and small just like a toy. It’s easy to use but I am confused at the beginning since it doesn’t have “on/off.” It has “mix/max” and levels of hot to choose. I don’t try the spray water function cuz I use it to iron my mattress. I’m trying to get rid of dust mite that I’m not sure if my bed had it or not. The quality looks cheap but somehow match its price. Hope it can stand longer. Cuz it looks like it will break easily lol...
customer_reviews.author: olivia

customer_reviews.title: great little iron!
customer_reviews.text: I got this little iron for my quilting projects. Sometimes you have what seems like hundreds of little seams to press and I got this to keep from hopping up to my ironing board. Then I made a little ironing board from a leftover piece of wood. I covered it with left over batting and then fabric. I used a staple gun to secure the layers of batting and fabric on the underside. No more hopping around to get my projects done.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Not Just for Clothing
customer_reviews.text: Okay - truth. I bought this particular iron because I paint and restore “curbside treasures.” People put marvelous solid wood furniture out at the street. I rescue it, and with a little wood glue, sanding, paint, and decoupage, it’s beautiful. I needed a small iron for my decoupaged projects, and this one has been perfect. It’s not too bad on quick clothing touch ups, either. Seriously, it’s really made completing projects so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid Larson

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get it.
customer_reviews.text: I never really read the reviews when a product has 1k+ good reviews but this thing sucks. I had gotten it bc my steamer broke for college and decided to go the old fashion way but this thing worked the first try but then rusted and then the next time I used it it stained my pants with rust. Would not recommend and would just go for a steamer instead.
customer_reviews.author: Belen H

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT use steam!
customer_reviews.text: Heats up well. Used without steam for quite awhile then tried adding water for steam. Immediately leaked EVERYWHERE!!! Great for using dry, just NOT with steam!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Casey

customer_reviews.title: VERY Affordable and EASY To Use
customer_reviews.text: This iron is perfect, in its ease of use, light weight and certainly in its price. Admittedly I have only used it once (as I just received it), but I was quite pleased with its performance. This iron is going to be primarily used to iron sewing projects and other small items. As such, I cannot say what its longevity would be should someone use this iron on large quantities of clothing. After one task, I am quite pleased.
customer_reviews.author: sensu01001101

customer_reviews.title: Love this iron!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a travel iron for quilting retreats. This one is excellent! It's small, but has a nice heated surface, can use with steam or dry. Handle is easy to grab and gives nice control. The power cord is very long - wonderful! It cools fairly fast, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product in December 2019 and just pulled it out to use it. I was very disappointed as it slightly warmed up and leaked water. As I tried to adjust the temperature, it quit working. I got less than what I paid for. I tried to contact Amazon, but due to the pandemic, I was unable to speak to anyone. Very disappointed! I would like a replacement if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in every way
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I have been looking for for years. Works great. Perfect size to keep on the edge of my sewing table so it is always available for use. As always with Amazon the price was very affordable and the shipping was fast.
customer_reviews.author: GWAMMA

customer_reviews.title: Too big for a travel iron.
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than I expected. I’m taking it because I don’t have time before departure to exchange it and I’ll need it for a 2-month trip where I’ll need it every week. I almost wish I just waited and bought a cheap iron in Korea, because I’ve done that before. I’m really disappointed. There are smaller ones out there; I’ve seen friends’ travel irons.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mills

customer_reviews.title: OK except....
customer_reviews.text: This little iron is ok except that it had WATER IN IT when it arrived. It was suppose to be new, so I can't imagine why it would have water in it...???? It works just fine - light weight and maneuverable. I use it with a wool mat for quilting and it does what I need. I would have given it 4 or 5 stars if it wasn't for the water issue... I question if it was really a new item.
customer_reviews.author: MAMABEAR

customer_reviews.title: Great traveling iron
customer_reviews.text: The was a last minute purchase when we learned our AirBnB in London didn't have an iron. Fits great in my suitcase and worked very well with the UK voltage. It has a US power cord with a 110/220 switch on the bottom. You'll need to carry the right power adapter for the country you'll be visiting, but not a voltage converter. I already had the UK adapter (see photo) and didn't have any issues. We will be carrying this with us for all our upcoming travels.
customer_reviews.author: HaygoodFam

customer_reviews.title: no automatic turnoff off
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in hopes I could use this in assisted living while recovering from mastectomy. For fear of a mishap I am returning for standard size. I have traveled aboard with a similar iron. It is a nice size for that. I bought upgraded iron mat and got a nice silcone type to put under iron. I will keep that. I think all irons should have automatic shutoff. Dangerous if not!
customer_reviews.author: Marlene

customer_reviews.title: Will not iron placemats and leaks rust!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to iron placemats. I didn't want a big bulky iron so I thought this would be perfect. It didn't remove wrinkles from standard cotton blend placemats, even on steam setting. It did however spray brown rusty water which stained two of my placemats. I am so unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sunbeam Hot-2-Trot Travel Iron
customer_reviews.text: The iron is a good size for traveling. It's a bit hard to hold because of the way the handle is. I'd prefer an open handle where I can hold on better. With the cord being at the side of the iron, instead of on the back part, the cord catches on the material and makes ironing a bit difficult. Other than the cord placement and handle, it's a good iron.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Great little iron
customer_reviews.text: Great little iron. I have this in the sewing space for using with my tabletop ironing board. Very handy little gizmo. The only reason it doesn't get that fifth star is where the water opening is is very odd and a bit unhandy. But that's very minor - this little guy does the job - I love Sunbeam Irons anyway and this is my third!! I have used them for years - they give great service and you can get them at the drug store nearest you. No problems at all with Sunbeam. Had one for 23 years now and another for 5 and now this little one. :)
customer_reviews.author: MGSTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Great little replacement...
customer_reviews.text: Had a Conair mini iron for about 15 years. Wanted something for next to my sewing machine, for quilting projects, to avoid the to/from involved with a big ironing board and associated iron. This is very hot when needed, doesn't smoke, doesn't smell hot, and is lightweight for travel. An excellent purchase and works perfectly for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: P.B.

customer_reviews.title: A joke
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect much but it leaks quite a bit and only steams when upright. Testing it out resulted in a wet garment,still wrinkled. Intended for use on a trip and left with needing a better one within a week. Boo
customer_reviews.author: Christi

customer_reviews.title: Great little cheap iron for edge banding!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for putting on wood veneer edge banding. It was cheap and I wanted a dedicated iron instead of using the same one we use for clothes. This little iron heats up fast and does a great job with the edge banding, no issues so far!
customer_reviews.author: A. Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful!!
customer_reviews.text: I have this little iron and it is AWESOME!!!. I make quilts for a living and this iron is perfect for ironing the seams as well as the blocks and It gets very hot!! You can adjust it. When you turn it all the way to cool, it did go off. I used this iron every day for almost 3 years and it finally went out but I cannot complain. It's been one of the best I have had. I am actually going to order another one in just a few moments.
customer_reviews.author: DEBBIE

customer_reviews.title: Small, high heat and gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: Small and efficient! Great for quilting and ironing out small fabric for sewing projects. I make doll clothes, quilts, hair bows and several other fabric projects. It heats up fast and gets the job done. It can get into books and crannies that bigger full size irons can’t get into. Affordable price and packs well in a suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: M.B.

customer_reviews.title: Heats up fast and works great
customer_reviews.text: I used it in my dorm when I had less space and needed a quick iron job. I could just use it on my bed and it worked fine. It heats up within minutes and irons just like a regular iron. Doesn't spurt out discharge, but I also just use filtered water too and that usually prevents it. Stores easily, but don't store it with water inside because the cap isn't water tight and will just spill water if you turn the iron over or to the side.
customer_reviews.author: WangChung

customer_reviews.title: THINK I WAS SENT A "USED" IRON - SPIT BROWN RUSTY WATER AND RUINED A BRAND NEW TOP!
customer_reviews.text: I really loved the compact size which is perfect for traveling. WHAT I DID NOT LIKE is the fact that it spit brown rusty water on my brand new top when I used the iron for the very first time. Now top is ruined!!! I guess I should have believed the other reviews where this was the same issue they had when they purchased the iron.
customer_reviews.author: JAH

customer_reviews.title: This Iron is Great for a Retreat
customer_reviews.text: I love this little iron. I primarily use it for retreats and such but have used it when I sew at home too. There are a few reasons I really like it. It gets very hot (unlike many other small irons). It steams very well without leaking. Its wattage is lower than many other irons. That lower wattage is really important at a retreat when there are MANY irons pulling electricity.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Schnellenberger

customer_reviews.title: It works just like a full-size iron
customer_reviews.text: This travel size iron is incredibly cute! It is small enough to put in a small suitcase or carry-on bag and still has all the features of a full-size iron. It is very light and the steam feature gets all the creases out. Without steam it still gets light wrinkles out. In a small apartment or dorm room one could use this as the only iron, particularly if used with a table-top ironing board that could be hung on a closet rod. Happy grandma.
customer_reviews.author: Segelkatt

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable for the price
customer_reviews.text: I live in a college dorm, so I don't have space for a full sized iron and ironing board— I got this instead, along with a mini tabletop board. This iron definitely leaks sometimes, especially if you prop it up to sit on its "butt" while you wait for it to heat up or whatever, but it's honestly not leaky enough to be detrimental or even annoying. It heats up super quickly, like within two minutes, which is awesome. And it really does the job, it doesn't just kind of smooth out your clothes as you might expect from an iron of this size. I'm really glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Casper

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS IRON!
customer_reviews.text: I 💘 this iron. I've spent much more over the years and received muck less. I bought it to use on sewing - it is perfect! $10-$15 less expensive than a smaller craft iron but maneuver in tight covering broader surface. Don't likes... No heat control settings. Steam gets extremely hot very fast. It WILL burn. If you turn the steam off while plugged in - it is still hot. If the steam is turned on, it will take less than 30 seconds to heat "be very careful".
customer_reviews.author: Doug Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Compact Cheap Amazing Iron!
customer_reviews.text: The durability is actually quite good. I bought this for my perler beads since i was looking for a cheap alternative for buying a iron. I came across this one and I am honestly really surprised. It heats up very got and it is super easy to use and the compact size makes it super easy to hold! Definitely recommended if you're looking for something compact but still one hundred percent the same functions as a regular sized iron!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: this little guy works
customer_reviews.text: bought this mainly for ironing on patches, cheaper than buying new pants. it works great for this, they stick and stay after washing. good product.
customer_reviews.author: mr black

customer_reviews.title: Best iron
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this iron!! I made a small ironing table from a tv table and this is the perfect iron for that. It does not leak like my last one, it fits in the palm of my hand, and is a great addition to my quilting corner. Bravo!!!
customer_reviews.author: Judith Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small projects
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use on a table by my sewing machine. This works great for small projects. It was a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: AmyM

customer_reviews.title: Leaks water
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I travel to Asia quite a bit for business and they rarely have irons in the hotel rooms. I'm very disappointed because now that I'm back from my trip it's too late to return and it leaks water all over the place as soon as you lay it flat to iron. I will be throwing this away.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, little iron.
customer_reviews.text: This is so CUTE! It's a mini steam iron that works very well. I bought it for my daughter to take when she goes to college, along with a small ironing board. I had to try it out first to make sure it worked. It works quite well and it uses tap water. It is smaller than most irons so you have to go over things multiple times so it's not made for anyone who irons a lot of clothing on a regular basis but it's perfect for travel, a dorm or a sewing room.
customer_reviews.author: Sewcrafty

customer_reviews.title: It’s the perfect size. It’s currently being used for my quilting ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this for sewing projects. It’s the perfect size. It’s currently being used for my quilting project, so it’s getting used quite a bit. The only downside is the area where you put the water in is a little cheap. It leaks if you fill it to the max line. So you have to under fill it. The lid that covers the hole, broke on me so I had to fix that myself
customer_reviews.author: Professor Crumbs

customer_reviews.title: Quilters' Favorite
customer_reviews.text: This is my wife's second Sunbeam 800W compact iron. The first I found at a resale shop so have no idea how old it was, but it lasted about 5 years before it gave up. Quilters love these little irons and my wife is no exception. So this one performs just as expected. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin K. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: It leaks like a sieve
customer_reviews.text: It leaks like a sieve, unfortunately on your clothes while you’re trying to iron. I got one and amazon graciously replaced it, however the replacement is as bad... I’m returning this one for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: After a few days of use, the rotary wheel to set the temperature became stuck and would not turn. I managed to set it for the temperature I needed. Thereafter, I did not move the wheel to set or to turn off . When I was done using iron, I just unplugged it.
customer_reviews.author: Marly

customer_reviews.title: appears to be nice,cheap iron
customer_reviews.text: its an iron.will take some getting use to the solid body with no comfortable place to put your fingers,seams alittle hard to control where you are pressing never had something like this.use it in my sewing room so it will get used but not on real important items.major complaint it spit hot water on my fingers,which I will not tolerate(have trashed others for that ) and the first I used it ,it smelled like a coal fired furnace,.will learn to use it,it was cheap,made in china,so what can I expect.recommend with reservations.it did press my quilt binding fine except the cord kept pulling the iron where it should not have
customer_reviews.author: Janice A. Linkowski

customer_reviews.title: Small, lightweight, perfect
customer_reviews.text: Needed a small iron for travel and home. I don't use one often, but it's nice to have one. This one is just the right size. It is compact and lightweight. The handle portion fits perfectly in the palm of the hand. Temperature settings seem to work properly. Steam feature works well, and the button for a quick burst of steam works well too. The only issue I find is you MUST make sure the water well is COMPLETELY empty before packing it for travel. It will leak.
customer_reviews.author: smb683

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect small iron for quilting and sewing
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect small iron for quilting and sewing. It's plate is small, which is nice when you're ironing small quilt pieces or sewing projects, and it's nice not to have a big iron hogging up my sewing space. I read that there's problems with water leaking from this, so I just keep a water bottle nearby and spray my fabric before ironing, rather that relying on the internal steam. Seems to be fitting the bill perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Christy H.

customer_reviews.title: Great iron for small project
customer_reviews.text: Since I'm making mask almost daily this iron works perfectly and doesn't throw out as much he has my full size iron. I chose sunbeam because I believe in their products. Steam works well as long as the temperature of the iron is set hot enough.
customer_reviews.author: RoxanneI

customer_reviews.title: perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I love it it's perfect for wat i wanted it for. I have some people that want to customize their masks and it fits perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Angelica

customer_reviews.title: They sent a dirty cracked used one
customer_reviews.text: Why does this look used? It’s dirty and the directions booklet is also stained. That’s gross af
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Iron
customer_reviews.text: Really nice miniature iron. It is proportioned exactly like a full-size iron, but much smaller. I'm not exactly a clothes ironer - my official ardrobe is jeans and a dark T-shirt - so I couldn't tell you how it does for clothing. But as a tool, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: justanotherlee

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a quilter and needed something small and mighty that I can take on retreats to use with my wool pressing mat. SCORE! This heats up SO FAST and doesn't take as long as I expected to cool down to pack up. Please know that I do not use water in any of my irons anymore! It does nothing but frustrate me and leak. I have a full size Rowenta which I love and it is working beautifully with NO WATER! I now use water and Mary Ellen's Best Press in spray bottles, when needed, and I am a happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: Ardgroom

customer_reviews.title: Works for 3 mins, then never again. Faulty product. Never written online review before this iron.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first online review of anything EVER. i turned this iron on for the first time and it heated for a solid 3 minutes before it went cold, never to heat up again. I have given it one day, four day, one week, two week breaks to see if it will heat up again and alas nothing. A very poorly made product. Incredibly disappointed. Please take my advice and invest in a better iron, otherwise you will just be paying for this one and having to buy another two months later. I would like to know how to be reimbursed.
customer_reviews.author: emily cohen

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty dang well for it's size
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty dang well for it's size. Definitely better for iron-ons or arts n' craft projects rather than for ironing clothes, but still does the trick if you're a broke student living in dorms with clothes all wrinkled from being folded and crammed into drawers. I mainly use it to put iron-on patches on my backpack and other things. It takes a few minutes to heat up and you sorta have to iron longer than you would with a full-sized iron, but I found this to be useful because it makes it less likely that you'll singe your clothes or whatever you're ironing.
customer_reviews.author: A. Walters

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is the most amazing little iron I've ever used. My sewing buddy has one and set it up because she was only sewing smaller quilting squares. I used it for my narrow/smaller seams on sleeves and a collar and WOW it was great. It also worked well on the entire skirt, but being so small it was a bit time consuming on the entire skirt. It lives in my sewing box and goes with me when I travel. It's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: K.Stanford

customer_reviews.title: Item came with burned cord!
customer_reviews.text: Product was correct size and same item as pictured however the item was supposed to be brand new and on the plug you can tell it is a used item. There are brown burn markings on the plug in and cord.
customer_reviews.author: Kiley Preston

customer_reviews.title: Wont last a year.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was a great little iron. Easy to hold. But if you hold you close to the base it will burn you. I bought it in May and by January it was toast the switch no longer works and now I have to go for another one. Will be looking into other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Banks54

customer_reviews.title: Not very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: The cord is on the side so very hard to grab, sit on table & use quickly. It leaks water when you lower it to use & NO auto shut off like most irons. I'm returning it for a better product
customer_reviews.author: tamara

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done....
customer_reviews.text: This lil iron pack a lot of power. It’s compact, heats evenly & gets hot in no time. I use this iron for when I make my masks to press out the fabric. I’m happy w/this purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Armonie V.

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Given the price, it does the trick. However, this thing tends to leak, even if not filled to the line. I have to leave it on for a bit and press the steam button a few times before I can trust that it won't leak. Wouldn't trust it if I were in a jam to get somewhere quick because there's a good chance my shirt would end up with a wet spot. Decent otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Ty4tehreply

customer_reviews.title: For iron on
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for iron-on vinyl. It works perfect, and the small size is easy to store. Plus, reasonable price
customer_reviews.author: XUEMEI JIN

customer_reviews.title: Great little iron!
customer_reviews.text: I used one like this at a recent quilt retreat. I had to have one of my own. It heats quickly and has steam to help set your press. I also LIKE the fact that it does NOT shut off after a specified amount of time. My table partner and I used it most of the day without having to wait for it to reheat. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Nette

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is great for an apartment where you don't have a ton of space and don't have a ton of items that need ironing. I love this for quick ironing jobs and also use it for quilting
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Hildebrand

customer_reviews.title: small but packs a big punch!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a small apartment with not a lot of room. I like to iron all my clothes but have no room for an ironing board to fit anywhere. With this iron I can hide it anywhere and do all my ironing on my kitchen counter. If you have not a lot of space in your place, get this iron.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this iron for about 2 years now and it gets the job done. It is smaller compared to standard irons however you really can't go wrong since it's so cheap. I've never used it with water so I can't comment on that but it works and continues to work. I probably use it 3-5 times a month and heats up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I love this little travel iron! Truthfully, I use it for my crafting, but it works so much better than my normal iron that I have. If you're into perler, I highly suggest using this, since it makes my pieces come out so much better!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Good for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to maneuver, but doesn’t get hot enough to get fold marks out of cotton woven.
customer_reviews.author: SchoepFam11

customer_reviews.title: A toy
customer_reviews.text: This is an expensive toy lol. I spent time using this iron just for my clothes to stay wrinkled. I wish I could return it ASAP. Do not buy unless you want to waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Kafilat

customer_reviews.title: Leaks water everywhere
customer_reviews.text: As convenient as having an iron this size is to use in conjunction with my small hot iron pad, this thing leaks EVERYWHERE. I made sure to not fill above the line, but if this thing has any water in it at all it leaks. Mine it leaks from somewhere in the plastic casing. I can't see where its leaking from so I guess its just not sealed correctly. Because of that it doesn't iron clothes very well. If your clothing is very wrinkled you might as well forget about ironing it with this. I'm very disappointed. Its so cheap it wasn't worth returning, however.
customer_reviews.author: Dogelas

customer_reviews.title: So convenient, but keep it clean
customer_reviews.text: I and another guy on my Europe mission trip both brought this iron. I was so pleased with it. It heated up quickly, converted to the European power (you'll need outlet prong adapters, though), and got the job done quickly. It works just as well as a steamer, too. Just hang up your clothes and push the steam button. BE AWARE, however, that if you're using water that has any amount of minerals in it (for example, ALL water in Europe), the minerals will start to collect on the faceplate and leave burnt crusts here and there which in my case only ever came off on my white dress shirt collars. So...use distilled water if at all possible.
customer_reviews.author: David Galvin

customer_reviews.title: Good for small quilting projects
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this iron for travel to quilt class... Works great for small pieces. Only issue is with the wattage some classes would not allow use due to multiple irons plugged in will trip breakers... (not this iron's fault, but something to consider depending on your plans for this lil thing).
customer_reviews.author: amazonnut

customer_reviews.title: Mini hot iron
customer_reviews.text: Bought actually to melt the adhesive when applying wood veneer on plywood. Works great so far
customer_reviews.author: Enrique13

customer_reviews.title: A tiny little steam machine!
customer_reviews.text: This iron is perfect for baby/small kid clothes. It fits in the tiny sleeves and collars. And it holds water forEVER, way better than my full size iron somehow, even with steam on! I've started using this one pretty much all the time in lieu of my full size iron. I just find it easier to manage in general.
customer_reviews.author: jvazjess

customer_reviews.title: Quality, looks, and durability and price are important
customer_reviews.text: I like this iron because it's small and compact for small projects.. it could be a little hotter..... Overall it's really nice.. I would recommend it definitely. And I have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Sunbeam Hot-2-Trot 800 Watt Compact Non-Stick Soleplate Travel Iron, GCSBTR-100-000,Light Blue
product_meta.description:
Sunbeam Travel Iron



The portable Sunbeam iron offers dual voltage (240/120v) and a compact design that is great for travel. Plus, it includes the Shot of Steam feature that provides an extra burst of steam for deep penetration of stubborn wrinkles. The non-stick soleplate glides easily over clothes.

 * Includes Dual Voltage
 * Non-Stick Soleplate
 * Shot of Steam
 * Variable Temperature
 * Soft Touch Handle and Dial
feature_bullets: Shot of Steam feature presses out wrinkles and presses in creases
Indicator light that lets you know the iron is hot
Variable temperature controls heat setting offers flexibility for various fabric types
Soft touch handle and dial to provide extra comfort

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,970 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
